Occupational Therapist – Grade 2 Sub- Acute

Company Name Mercy Health Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role

This is an exciting opportunity to join our dynamic, supportive Occupational Therapy Department and an expanding public health service that is committed to ensuring high quality, evidence-based, person-centred, safe and effective patient care. This position is an integral part of the Occupational Therapy and Allied health team in assisting to deliver sustainable contemporary systems and services across our sub-acute inpatient services. You will have opportunities to develop your leadership skills whilst part of a team which also includes grade 1 and grade 3 Occupational Therapists and Allied Health Assistants.
  • Grade 2 Occupational Therapist, full-time, permanent. Job share considered.
  • Based at Werribee Mercy Hospital
  • Friendly and supportive Occupational Therapy team.
  • Sub-acute inpatient occupational therapy stream
  • Working closely with the multidisciplinary teams across inpatient services.
  • Strong emphasis on actively contributing to the Occupational Therapy service and AH team.
  • A great opportunity to develop and extend your leadership skills.
About You
  • Recognised Degree in Occupational Therapy and current full occupational therapy registration with AHPRA
  • Strong, clinical skills and experience relevant for sub-acute occupational therapy
  • Demonstrated clinical leadership and supervision capabilities
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and effective communication skills and practices with a high level of integrity and professionalism
  • Strong working knowledge of current evidence based practices and a commitment to continuous quality improvement, and professional development of self and others
  • Enthusiastic, flexible, dedicated, team-oriented
About Us

Werribee Mercy Hospital is a General Public Hospital located in the rapidly growing western suburbs of Melbourne. Our services include surgical, medical, maternity, newborn, renal dialysis, emergency, mental health, rehabilitation, aged and palliative care. The hospital is currently undergoing significant expansion with a number of exciting capital projects currently underway, including an $85 million State Government funded redevelopment that will deliver a new critical care unit and take the total number of beds to 298. Join us now and be part of our team as we expand to serve our community.

Mercy Health is a Catholic organisation employing over 8500 people who provide compassionate and holistic care through our acute hospitals, aged care facilities, mental health programs, palliative and respite services, maternity and women’s health services, early parenting services and home care services.

Mercy Health is proud to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the WGEA.

What We Offer
  • Values driven culture
  • Salary packaging benefits
  • Leadership Capability Framework to support your career progression and development
  • Camp Australia School Holiday Program
  • Thrive @ Mercy – our health & wellbeing hub supporting you to be the best you can be
  • Stepping Stones – our flexibility framework supporting your growth and work life balance
  • Fully funded childcare referral service
To find out more about these exciting initiatives, please visit Mercy Health Careers homepage (http//careers.mercy.com.au/)

At Mercy Health we pride ourselves on embracing diversity and foster an inclusive culture where individual differences are respected and celebrated. We encourage applications from people of all ages, abilities and cultural backgrounds including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander Peoples.

Mitchell Shire Council provides its employees with the opportunity to maintain a healthy work / life balance whilst performing challenging yet rewarding work. Employees have access to a range of ongoing professional development and a range of employee benefits designed to align with our ‘One Mitchell’ Philosophy.

    \xa0

    We are after someone with a customer first mindset! Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, you deliver a service in a highly customer centric and business partner approach as you will join a team of two other Managers Oral Health Agencies that monitor performance and support initiatives across the Victorian community.

    \xa0

    The most important part of your role is people! Stakeholder engagement is what drives you and your work will require you to visit community dental agencies in Western Victoria.     \xa0

    You will join an organisation that is passionate about delighting our customers with the best possible experience. To help us do this, we're always searching for talented people with great ideas, energy and a passion for helping others. Does it sound like you and what you are looking for in your next career?

    \xa0

    We provide services through our Royal Dental Hospital of Melbourne where you will have the opportunity to work with the best oral health practitioners in Victoria. Job description

WHO WE ARE

Betfair is the world’s largest, and Australia’s only, peer-to-peer wagering platform. We service a sophisticated customer base and offer a different way for punters to engage with racing and sport by facilitating transactions between people. Betfair is driven by the unique Betting Exchange motivated by leading technology from the UK, operating in a highly competitive market-place. Betfair Australia is owned by the ASX-listed Crown Resorts Ltd, who are the creators of Crown Casino in Melbourne, and Crown Casino Burswood in Perth.

\xa0

OUR CULTURE

Betfair is an energetic and inspirational workplace where no day is the same. A creative & nurturing culture, we love coming to work.

We’re proud of Team Betfair, we’d back them any day of the week. While we love to champion a win, how we play the game is just as important. So, our culture is all about individuals working hard, but working together in a collaborative and supportive way.


THE TEAM

The Operations team is a small but impactful duo that supports the breadth of Operational functions across the business, particularly in Hobart and Darwin. Supporting teams such as Customer Service, Market Operations, Risk & Optimisation and Technology, we exist to champion everything Operations at Betfair!


THE ROLE

Betfair has an exciting opportunity for a part time Hobart Office Manager to join the team in our Hobart office.


Reporting to the Operations Director, the Hobart Office Manager is responsible for the day to day management of the Hobart Office and other facilities related activities.

The role will ensure the smooth running of the office, ensuring business needs are serviced in a timely fashion, while providing administrative support to:

  • Senior Leadership Team
  • People & Culture
  • Facilities
  • Contract Management


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE


Administration/Facilities

This role requires the ability to deal unsupervised, with a vast array of issues and vendors as required:

  • Managing incoming and outgoing mail, couriers, express post for Hobart Office
  • Assist with the internal and external functionality of the Hobart Office, liaising with Department of Economic Development, cleaning and maintenance contractors
  • Managing the procurement of stationery, kitchen supplies and merchandise for the Hobart Office, ensuring they are stocked accordingly
  • All administrative and organisational duties relating to the successful running of the general office facilities in Hobart
  • Maintain working relationships with the landlord and liaise for all building and facility enquiries/issues
  • Provide administrative support for and in conjunction with business managers, to include, supplier contract management, maintenance of office supplies and general administrative tasks
  • Provide support to the Melbourne Administration Assistant with travel bookings across all sites


Other

And any other duties or tasks, as directed, within your skills and experience

\xa0

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

  • Self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously
  • Sound knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
  • A welcoming personality and the ability to build strong working relationships
  • Demonstrated experience in an office administration environment with multi-task responsibilities
  • Effective oral and written communication
  • Evidence of the practice of a high level of confidentiality
  • Excellent time management organisational skills
  • Able to take initiative. You get things done

Estimator

Company Name Blue Star Group Australia Company Location Sunshine, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Location – Sunshine, Melbourne

  • Display and VM POS industry leader
  • Modern facilities and working environment
  • Blue chip clients


Blue Star DISPLAY is a subsidiary of ASX listed IVE Group - Australia’s most diversified print and marketing communications business.


With operations in Sydney and Melbourne, Blue Star DISPLAY specialises in the design/creation and the production of VM POS, temporary, semi-permanent and permanent retail displays.

Our state-of-the-art facilities house the latest technology, providing large scale capability across Offset and Wide Format printing, finishing, kitting and warehousing. \xa0

Our services also include off-shore sourcing where appropriate through a dedicated team based in Asia.


About The Role


Blue Star DISPLAY VIC is currently looking for an experienced, commercially sound and success oriented Estimator to join our team. You will be required to draw upon your knowledge base and experience to estimate a diverse range of projects expediently and accurately, with the primary focus on wide format digital, finishing, packing and kitting for our retail based clients with POS and Display requirements.

\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

Estimators play a vital role within the business through the production of accurate and detailed quotations for our clients. These go on to form the basis of all work instructions for jobs entering our production environment. We currently have a great opportunity for a person to join the Estimating team. Working closely within a small team within the Sales environment, the successful candidate will have the ability to communicate and establish functional relationships comfortably at all levels of the organization.


To be successful in this role, experience and a strong understanding of Print production is essential. Strong computer literacy and numerical skills are essential to be able to estimate and evaluate requests for quotations from our Sales team.


Our clients require us to work on innovative solutions and one off projects, thus the work can be both challenging and varied. You will be required to meet tight deadlines for all quotations and will be expected to demonstrate a consultative and collaborative approach. Excellent communication skills and attention to detail are a must and a positive, helpful attitude is essential.


In return for this we offer you the opportunity to be part of a large and successful business and a chance to be a key team member. Specific responsibilities include:


  • Working within the existing estimating, production and sales team to estimate POS projects
  • Clearly interpret clients briefs and specifications to reflect client requirements
  • Manage and control multiple estimates to multiple stake-holders
  • Maintain proactive and positive internal client relationships with sales, production and shopfloor staff
  • Ensure documentation and deliverables are of a high standard
  • Contribute to the successful outcomes of the account service team by promoting teamwork and displaying a friendly and positive attitude


About you:


A team player, you will have the following skills and experience:


  • Previous experience as an Estimator in Printing or a similar or related industry
  • Clear understanding of the processes in a printing and manufacturing environment
  • A sound knowledge of substrates, stocks, their end use and supply chain
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work flexibly as a member of a team
  • A proactive approach to communication and to issue identification and resolution
  • Great problem solving skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills


If you believe you are the right person for this job, please apply now! We want to hear from you.

Please attach a resume with your application.

836484709:
[

Quality & Completions Manager

Company Name CPB Contractors Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 153 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Now is an exciting time to jump on board as we deliver the second package of the Metro Tunnel works

About RIA

CPB Contractors, as part of the Rail Infrastructure Alliance (RIA), has been named as the Victorian Government’s preferred proponent to deliver a $1 billion package of works in support of the $11 billion Metro Tunnel Project.

CPB Contractors and John Holland are equal construction partners in the RIA, with AECOM as the design partner. The RIA also comprises project owner Rail Projects Victoria (formerly the Melbourne Metro Rail Authority) and operational franchisee Metro Trains Melbourne.

About The Project

This is the second package of Metro Tunnel works to be delivered by CPB Contractors, following the award of a $1 billion design and construct contract as part of the Rail Systems Alliance (RSA) in December 2017.

Construction is expected to commence in late 2018 and be completed by 2025.

This fourth major works package for the Metro Tunnel Project covers the existing Sunbury rail line between the western tunnel entrance in Kensington and Tottenham, and the Dandenong rail line between the eastern tunnel entrance in South Yarra and Caulfield Station.

Major works for the Alliance include the design and construction of entrance structures that will interface with Metro Tunnel works at South Yarra and Kensington.

About The Role

We are currently seeking applications for a Quality & Completions Manager, to join us on the Metro Tunnel Project as part of the Rail Infrastructure Alliance. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a high-profile Rail Infrastructure Project as part of one of Australia’s most highly regarded construction companies. With an enviable range of projects underway and in the pipeline, CPB can offer impressive opportunities for career progression.

As Quality & Completions Manager, you will be accountable for:
  • Lead the development, implementation and updating of the RIA quality management plan, QMS and quality processes in accordance with AS/NZS 9001:2016 and the contract
  • Work with the design and engineering teams to implement effective design management processes
  • Coordinate, develop and implement effective procurement and subcontractor management processes
  • Work with the Area Project Managers, Delivery Managers and Systems Assurance Manager to develop and implement effective construction verification processes
  • Participate in identification, assessment and effective mitigation of quality risks
  • Work with the Systems Manager to coordinate the integration of the Engineering Assurance and Safety Assurance processes into the QMS
  • Monitor quality performance and report to the senior management and other stakeholders
  • Coordinate the development and implementation of an audit schedule that consolidates requirements for each audit discipline in conjunction with the functional managers and the relevant Area Teams
  • Lead the identification and implementation of opportunities to improve the Project quality system, processes and products
  • Establish and monitor a process for the review and verification of Work Lot/Construction Package compliance, the management of non-conformance and corrective action
  • In conjunction with the Area Quality Engineers, provide appropriate management input into the rectification of any defects
  • Develop and implement quality/management system induction and training
  • Ensure that the requirements of the QMP are implemented and maintained


Our Minimum Requirements For This Role Are
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications and proven experience in the development and implementation of quality management systems on complex infrastructure projects
  • Quality assurance and control experience preferred
  • Project controls experience preferred
  • Demonstrated experience with successful outcomes on major / complex works
  • High attention to detail across all works
  • Working innovatively to achieve best for project

If you are interested in this role and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

We support diversity in the workplace. Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.

Please note: This role is being sourced through CPB Contractors directly and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.

Industry

  • Construction
  • Civil Engineering
  • Staffing and Recruiting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Quality Assurance
  • Research
  • Science

Company Name GHD Company Location 180 Lonsdale Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 19 views

Job description

Why GHD?

As one of the world’s leading professional services companies, GHD has much to offer. Become part of a connected global network operating across five continents and the Pacific region. Passionate about the communities in which we live, GHD has a reputation for providing innovative solutions. With a broad client base, interesting work and a supportive culture we’ll inspire you to reach your potential.

\xa0

The role

GHD is proud to have one of Australasia's largest Geotechnical practices. Our clients tap into more than 150 specialist geoscience professionals, including engineers, geologists, geophysicists and hydrogeologists who provide comprehensive investigation and design services, with a focus on large scale infrastructure projects.

\xa0

We have an exciting opportunity for a technically-focussed Technical Director - Tunnelling Structural Engineer\xa0to join our conveniently located Melbourne CBD based group. This key role will provide a balance of technical work, project management, business development and mentoring.

\xa0

Primary responsibilities include

  • Technically lead a range of tunnel and underground space projects
  • Tunnel engineering design, including TBM and mined tunnels in hard rock and soft ground conditions
  • Permanent and temporary underground design structure
  • Oversee the production of design deliverables including drawings, specifications and reports
  • Involvement in geotechnical and tunnel engineering risk assessments
  • Establish and maintain effective relationships with clients and across GHD
  • Mentor, motivate and support junior members of the group.

Key criteria

  • Relevant qualification

  • Strong technical background

  • Ability to lead, mentor and develop a talented team to deliver exceptional results for our clients by applying a proactive and collaborative approach

  • Be commercially astute and effective – use your high level of market awareness and business development skills.

Our offer

Fostering gender balance, diversity and acceptance of flexible working for men and women have been central to the way GHD does business. As is creating a nurturing environment where people are empowered and are encouraged to bring their whole-self to work. You will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from inspiring colleagues as well as personalised career development through the GHD Business School.

\xa0

Benefits

  • Access up to eight weeks annual leave

  • Staff discounts on selected health insurance, gyms, travel and accommodation

  • A generous parental leave policy for both women and men

  • Access to an employee assistance program

  • A variety of flexible working arrangements

  • An inclusive environment that wins awards for workplace diversity.

\xa0

Join a professional community of more than 8,500 committed people who come together seamlessly and share a vision for a sustainable future.

\xa0

For a confidential discussion please contact Bridget O'Sullivan, Recruitment Business Partner on 03 8687 6000. Alternatively, please submit your application via www.ghd.com/careers.

\xa0

GHD does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies and is not responsible for any related fees.

Job description



At OPSM we are passionate about opening eyes to the unseen. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 80 years. We are not your typical retail business. We are obsessed with eye care and offering our customers the confidence in how they see the world.

We are part of Luxottica Group, a global eyewear company with over 7,000 retail stores across 130 countries and brands like Ray Ban, Oakley, Prada and Burberry to name a few. Working with us means you are part of something bigger.

In this part time role (7 hours per week + opportunity to flex up and do more hours at certain times) you will be part of a motivated and passionate team of experienced optical professionals based in our Coburg store. Your focus will be on understanding customer eye care needs and lifestyle requirements, and identifying how OPSM can help to maximise their lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyewear and eye care, including sunglasses, lenses, frames and accessories. While providing the highest level of tailored customer service, you will be an ambassador for a range of luxury brands and enjoy the sense of achievement in contributing to store success.

To succeed in this role, you will be a team player who cares intensely about delivering exceptional customer service. You will be curious and willing to learn optical concepts, and have a result-orientated mindset and motivation to share in our company success. Previous experience working in a customer service and sales driven retail environment is essential. Must be available weekends and late nights!

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. You will be able to access an industry leading training curriculum and support to ensure a smooth transition into the world of eye care, and diverse career pathways to pursue your career goals wherever that may be. We offer competitive salaries and incentives to recognise your contribution, a generous product allowance for you to enjoy wearing our premium brands and other benefits too. You will also have the opportunity to join our mission to help the world see by participating in our OneSight outreach program.

If you are a likeminded individual who truly cares for our customers, click apply and complete our quick and simple questionnaire to see if our values align.

Job description

PageUp delivers a Software-as-a-Service Talent Management solution that enables leading organisations globally to hire, onboard, develop and engage their people. We have an innovative software platform that is used by 2.6 million customer employee users in over 190 countries. Currently PageUp is experiencing significant growth and have created an opportunity for a Senior UI/Interaction Designer to join our team.


Your mandate is to expand our design capabilities ensuring consistent design throughout all product modules. Additionally setting the vision for visual language across mobile, tablet and desktop. You will contribute to the following;


  • Actively contribute to PageUp User Interaction/Interface vision and strategy.
  • Continuous thought leadership and evangelism with best practice interaction design.
  • Strong experience with wireframe and prototyping ideas.
  • Working collaboratively and educating the business, specifically Product Development, Marketing and clients on best practice design. Collaborating closely with the UX Engineer to ensure designs are developed in a consistent way.
  • Driving the development and adoption of our design principles.

We picture you as a Senior UI/Interaction designer who has worked collaboratively across different product teams to design\xa0native mobile and responsive web applications. The idea of developing and owning our global experience language excites you. You will be experienced in the delivery of production ready assets and with implementation of design work through collaboration with front end developers.\xa0 \xa0


We are fun, authentic, innovative, and above all passionate about creating ‘technology that people love to use’. Based in Melbourne, our product and development team is comprised of multiple cross-functional teams dedicated to projects ranging from client collaborations to new market initiatives and design.


Our product design team works in a collaborative style with a bias towards rapid prototyping, experimentation and a natural curiosity for our customers and their needs. Recognition comes in many forms at PageUp, monthly peer-nominated CEO awards and an extra annual leave day - the Awesome Day to do something you love. We are committed to providing compelling career opportunities for our people, steer your career and we'll support you to get there.


Drive your career forward. Apply Now.


\xa0

Job description

Microsoft is going through a transformational change to become a Cloud first, Mobile first company. At the same time, mobility and devices are two of the fastest growing and most top of mind issues for large Enterprises. Winning with Surface Devices is core to driving this transformation and capturing this opportunity.

The Microsoft Surface portfolio presents amazing opportunities for businesses. Commercial sales of Surface are growing rapidly, and we are looking for highly-experienced and motivated sales talent to help customers realize the value of Surface in their business. If you are a proven talent with experience in hardware sales, help us take this product to new heights in a market with millions of passionate customers and billions of dollars in business. We are an unmatched team comprised of talent, passion, expertise, and commitment.

Responsibilities

As a Surface Solution Specialist you will:

Be the Surface sales leader and expert for your assigned set of accounts as part of the Modern Workplace team:
  • Drive new revenue growth across a wide variety of Surface devices (Pro, Hub, Book, Studio, Laptop) by showing excellence in pipeline & inventory management to achieve monthly forecasts
  • Deliver customer business transformation and success through accelerated adoption and usage resulting in customer references that can be leveraged in future sales engagements
  • Compete aggressively and proactively to win new business and share through differentiated customer business value
  • Deliver briefings to customers, including Early Adopter Programs, to drive success of new and updated first party-devices
Be the interface to the customer and orchestrate a v-team of resources to solve customer problems:
  • Extend relationships beyond IT to business decision makers, helping customers envision & achieve digital transformation
  • Solve customer business challenges by presenting the value of Surface devices, including use cases, financial analysis, ROI, etc.
  • Own oportunities from start to close by orchestarting virtual teams consisting of technical and partner roles; leverage partners to scale sales on hardware refresh, upsell and expand sales motions
  • Support operational execution of complex deals with operations and product teams
  • Collaborate with other technical and sales roles to close sales
  • Make others great at selling Surface devices
Stay sharp and assist Microsoft transform how we deliver value to customers:
  • Continuously nurture and expand sales, business, technology, and competitive readiness
  • Participate in internal Microsoft sales communities and in the broader industry through events, yammer, community gatherings and more

Qualifications

Professional
  • Strategic thinking & execution. Ability to develop sales and business strategy options, while also being able to successfully execute on complex opportunities.
  • Excellent Communicator. Strong negotiation, organizational, presentation, financial acumen, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Performer. Highly driven person who consistently exceeds goals and expectations and has the ability, characteristics, and determination to compete effectively against skilled and diverse competition.
  • Collaborative. Work cohesively with members of the Microsoft sales & services field, Microsoft partners, and Microsoft corporate sales, engineering, and marketing to solve customer and partner issues, leverage best practices, & deliver results.
  • Growth Mindset. Ability to overcome and work around problems that are inevitable in rapidly growing businesses - positive approach to problem solving, learning, and development of potential
  • Travel Required: 50%.
Sales
  • Amazing Salesperson: Exhibits outstanding operational excellence, including forecasting, healthy pipeline development, CRM entry and hygiene, opportunity management and virtual team orchestration.
      • 5-10 years of experience in enterprise sales; 3-5 years of experience in hardware sales.
      • Proven success in closing complex deals and technical understanding of devices and commercial requirements.
      • Good understanding of Microsoft’s business model and sales model.
  • Exceeds sales goals in an assigned sales territory.
  • Leader: Demonstrated sales and partner management experience; strong passion for building and driving a business
  • Challenger mindset: Competes to win new market share
  • Influential: Significant experience delivering persuasive presentations to C-level business decision makers.

Education
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a similar information technology related discipline (required)

  • MBA (preferred)

Job description

Broadspectrum is an operations, maintenance and construction services organisation, operating globally in the resources, energy, industrial, infrastructure, rail, property and defence sectors. This is a diverse and growing business offering the training, opportunities and support you need to begin and build a successful career.

The Position

The Local Site Administrator provides support for the mandated Defence IT systems in particularly the Military Integrated logistics Information System (MILIS) which is employed across the Retail Stores Sites. This role will also ensure utilisation of defence systems are carried out in accordance with the contract requirements and appropriate Defence, Government and Broadspectrum Policy. The successful candidate will ideally have a logistics background combined with strong MILIS experience or similar., located preferably in Melbourne or Brisbane but is not limited - all locations will be considered for the right candidate.

Responsibilitiess may also include:

  • Assurance and Compliance as part of the Technical Capability Team – RESPOL & Transport
  • Logistic Systems Administrator managing the access, reports and performance within MILIS for RESPOL and Directorate of Logistics Estate and Infrastructure Group
  • Ensure contract obligations are met with respect to service delivery IAW CWBD, Statement of Works, procedures and instructions, statement of works and Broadspectrum procedures and instructions
  • Monitoring and assessing the performance of service delivery functions by site and region against Compliance Indicators and Key Performance Indicators as specified with the contract
  • Identify and recommend training of personnel with respect to the requirement of the Military Integrated Logistics Information System (MILIS), ROMAN, COMSARM, CVS, DTP, Ammunition, POL and related Defence supplied training in Stores, POL and transport environment
  • Investigation, action and closure of complaints received from the client and corrective actions
  • Contribute to the successful achievement of winning new business under the direction of the National Technical Manager Stores and Transport
  • Recommend and monitor improvements to the service to improve productivity and/or reduce cost

Skills and Experience Required:

  • Sound knowledge of the Military Integrated Logistics Information System (MILIS) and the Electronic Supply Chain Manual (ESCM) essential
  • Compentent in assurance and auditting activities
  • Experience in management of Stores and Transport and/or relevant operations across a diverse client and/or geographical base
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasking and time, and to deliver a value for money seamless service
  • High Level of inter-personnel and communication skills

The Benefits

Broadspectrum offers the opportunity to work in a diverse global environment with a culture of safety and integrity. This is your chance to work for a company that has an excellent culture and working environment. The opportunity to advance your career is on offer.





We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures that they bring to work with them each day. Embracing Diversity and Creating Inclusion is a key component of our Talent Management Strategy. The creation of a Diverse and Inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success, creating a high-performance business.

About the role

We are seeking a results driven Learning & Development Specialist to join our team. Reporting to the Learning and Development Manager, this role's key focus will be on the design, development and delivery of learning products and tools, assessment, evaluation and contributing to organisational learning needs analyses as required.

Dealing Operations Manager

Company Name ThinkMarkets Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

As the Dealing Operations Manager, you will be working closely with the trading, operations, and customer service teams. The main focus will be on the ongoing monitoring of market risk across the entire order book: FX, indices, cryptocurrencies, equities, and commodities. This includes tracking of exposure and articulating hedging recommendations to senior management based on an understanding of market trends, dynamics, and upcoming news. The ideal candidate will have a trading background and be able to identify strategies based on trade history and other quantitative analytics.

Ideally, you will have worked with FX, futures, and equities in the past and have a strong quantitative background, including work with SQL, Tableau, and Excel. In addition, the candidate will have experience in all aspects of the Financial Services industry such as analysis of order books, trade processing, and/or market data.

Experience in trading platforms and technologies is a definite plus, especially the ability to collaborate with IT teams in FIX-based integrations with additional banks and trading partners.

\xa0

\xa0

Responsibilities:

\xa0

  • Perform real-time management of risk and hedge as appropriate within agreed limits.
  • Monitor the proprietary system of trade-based alerts and escalate as necessary.
  • Provide daily review and explanation of the positions, P&L, and risk profile of the trading book to senior management.
  • Reconcile the liquidity providers' positions versus in-house positions.
  • Review and approve new products (FX and CFD products).
  • Supervise and manage the risk reporting tasks. Review the operation processes, roles, and responsibilities and ensure the process are implemented in accordance with the Group’s operational standard and requirements.
  • Liaise with colleagues globally to ensure smooth handover and synchronization of teams.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Desired Skills and Experience


  • Bachelor's, or Master’s degree in economics, computer science, mathematics, or a hard-science from a top university.
  • 3-7 years' work experience in a trading-related area, probably middle or back office.
  • Understanding of strategies in FX, futures, crypto space. High Frequency / Market making experience are also welcomed.
  • Technical knowledge of and experience with trading systems.
  • Proficiency in Excel and SQL (or R/ Python).
  • Disciplined self-starter with an ability to make well-balanced decisions and solve problems under pressure.
  • Good communication skills and the confidence to professionally challenge other’s ideas and opinions.

  • Strong people skills and an ability to engage all levels of the organization (especially frontline)
  • Strong interest and passion for coaching or mentoring clients.
  • A willingness to roll up your sleeves and work at all levels of a client organization.
  • An understanding of the principles of change management and performance metrics and dialogs
  • Comfort with extensive travel away from home city (4 days a week).
Who You'll Work With

As an Implementation Coach you will work within McKinsey Implementation (MI) – a rapidly growing capability for our firm. The Australian group has offices in Perth, Melbourne, and Sydney, however our work is national with travel to our clients’ sites. As a member of MI, you’ll work closely with our client project teams, providing end-to-end support to ensure the clients are able to deliver and sustain the full benefits of McKinsey’s recommended change in their business. Your goal as an implementation coach is to help clients build these capabilities in delivery and execution, both during an active project and continuing after our consultants have shared their recommendations.
What You'll Do

As a Implementation Coach your passion is coaching individuals to help them succeed. Implementation Coaches work with front line leaders within our clients helping them to deliver impact on critical issues. Your role is to manage projects and progress with minimal supervision, including tracking metrics, handling complex analyses, and preparing communications to report back to client and internal leadership. You will develop trust-based relationships with clients and be seen as a specialist in implementation and delivering results.

Working for MI will give you the opportunity to gain experience across a broad number of industry sectors outside of your current sector of knowledge. You will also become part of an outstanding and rapidly growing team within the firm. McKinsey puts strong emphasis on professional development, with many opportunities to develop your skills and expertise. Our consultants receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from within the firm.
Interested candidates please submit a resume and cover letter drawing reference to your suitable skills and experience in relation to the role as outlined above.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Banking
  • Consumer Goods
  • Financial Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Engineering
  • Manufacturing
  • Project Management

Job description

  • 2 Year Fixed Term Contract
  • Leading Gas and Pipeline infrastructure company
  • Southbank, Melbourne


Bring your energy! APA Group is one of Australia’s leading energy infrastructure businesses. As a part of the APA team, you’ll join a group of passionate professionals who work safely, and responsibly to deliver Australia’s energy.

As one of Australia’s ASX top 50 organisations we offer career and personal development opportunities, work-life balance, discounts, incentives and wellbeing programs.

Best of all, we are a bunch of great people to work with!

We now have an exciting opportunity available for a Project Engineer to join our Asset Engineering team in Southbank, Melbourne on a full time /fixed term basis for 24 months.

On a Day To Day Basis, Your Responsibilities Will Include

Reporting to the Project Delivery Manager, you will play a key role in the delivery of assigned projects including Stay in Business capex, major maintenance projects, and 3rd party recoverable works end-to-end.
  • Delivering the portfolio of project work in accordance with the Role Purpose requirements
  • Ensuring adherence to established company project framework, engineering and quality standards, customer and regulatory standards
  • Maintaining collaborative and productive working relationships with the Construction Supervisor, peers and customers
  • Ensure that all components of the project are delivered to scope, on schedule, within budget while complying with projects quality requirements, statutory regulations, applicable standards, client requirements and APA processes and procedures
  • Manage project reporting for clients and the APA Management
  • Identify and manage Project risks including health, safety and environment

To excel in this position you will have the following skills, experience, qualifications and attributes:
  • Experience and ability to manage projects in different disciplines, including mechanical, pipeline, electrical, instrumentation and controls
  • Industry experience in the design and operation of pipelines and facilities and associated process equipment.
  • A working knowledge of the latest codes in particular the AS2885, AS4041 and ASME B31.3 suite of standards.
  • Experience in on-site pipeline construction activities including welding and coating
  • Delivery of success – strong track record managing multiple projects simultaneously, and delivering results using innovative ideas
  • Experience in working with Contractors & Equipment Manufacturers and with major oil, gas, petrochemical and power project experience.

With a strong focus on achieving results, a collaborative working style and a values-based culture, APA offers you a career opportunity like no other!

If this sounds like a company and team that you’d like to be a part of we’d love to hear from you! Submit your application (covering letter and CV) by pressing the “Apply” button below before the closing date of 13 September, 2018

843354920:
[

Developer

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 49 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


We're reimagining the way Australians are able to search, find and finance their property dreams at REA and we'd love you to come help us.



About the role
The Software Developer supports the FinX Integration team in the following ways:

  • Designing, implementing, testing and deploying software products, working across the full stack
  • Predominantly focusing on front-end components using JavaScript, ReactJS and related technologies, but with the ability to contribute to back-end technologies using Java and Node.js
  • Contributing to the overall technical solution design
  • Managing and maintaining existing systems in line with our product custodianship strategy
  • Participating in engineering practices that produce testable, maintainable products to be proud of
  • We love to learn on the job so this role is as much about learning as it is teaching others




What we expect:

  • Demonstrated experience in software engineering using languages such as Javascript, Node.js or Java
  • An enthusiastic understanding of object orientated programming concepts
  • An appetite to work on both frontend and back-end systems
  • An understanding of common testing practices
  • Knowledge of software design patterns and best practices for software development
  • An understanding of common web and application architectures
  • Open to learning other languages and frameworks that support our technical direction




What is it like to work with us in Financial Services?
Each team in Financial Services has around 8-10 people who work together across technology, product and delivery as an autonomous unit. We work with a few 3rd party partners to bring to life our financial services offering and keep a close relationship with these partners. We believe strongly in pairing, testing and continuous delivery, mixed with large doses of fun. We support funded training and personal development.



Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work part time, and people who work from home one day a week.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry-leading parental leave system.
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes along with showers and clean towels for when you work up a sweat.




About the team
REA Financial Services purpose is to offer home finance and other financial services to those using realestate.com.au for their property search. Given the opportunity of the size of that audience, REAFS vision is to integrate a consumer's property search with finance though a world class digital seamless process. This will be achieved by building innovative consumer search and property finance application experiences that integrate the mortgage distribution channels of digital, phone and face to face. The financial services team is accountable for strategy development and execution, working with our banking and mortgage broker partners to build our capability and product offerings, leading sales management and engaging across the other lines of business in REA.



About REA Group
Our leading brand is Australia's biggest property resource, realestate.com.au. We also operate the number one commercial property site, realcommercial.com.au, and have businesses that help property developers and other brands advertise with us. Whilst we live in Australia, we've also got ventures in Asia and North America, and have the vision of expanding our footprint further. Everything we do is driven by our purpose to 'change the way the world experiences property' - from product innovation to our international investments.

  • Online Media

Full-time

Job description

Senior Data & Insights Analyst – People Analytics

  • Are you passionate about data, analytics and insights
  • Pride yourself in helping to deliver highly successful change performance for Australia’s leading brands
  • Full time permanent role could be based at Jetstar office in Melbourne

At Qantas we embrace data. With the internal data & analytics capability, we constantly look to deploy tools and technology to harness; process and to create insights of our experiences and predict effectiveness of strategies.

As Senior Data & Insights Analyst – People Analytics, part of the Strategic Workforce Planning team you will autonomously develop, build and maintain effective relationships with internal stakeholders to develop your knowledge and understanding and assist to influence performance improvement.

  • Proactively design, develop and complete strategic analysis by using and applying a thorough knowledge of Group-wide data sources, analytical techniques and tools to address key business challenges and opportunities
  • Use innovative approaches to discover new insights in existing data and incorporate new data for additional insights
  • Implement continuous improvement techniques to create efficiencies in the way analysis is conducted
  • Provide end to end management of projects from briefing, analysis to insights and recommendations
  • Complete data analysis to develop insights, identify strategic opportunities, champion the development of action plans and enable data driven decision making
  • Deliver high quality presentations to present insights from analysis and recommendations in a clear way that the business can action

Experience you’ll need to have:

  • 8-10 years’ experience in a similar role within a large corporate environment
  • A problem solving mindset focused on solving business challenges with the data available
  • Outstanding communication skills and demonstrated experience in building and maintaining effective business relationships
  • Advanced analytical skills with the ability to group information from multiple sources and draw conclusions using Excel/SQL/Qlik Sense and WorkDay highly desirable
  • Highly collaborative and a strong team player
  • A problem solver with the ability to think laterally in time critical situations
  • Self-directed with the aptitude to set priorities and work effectively in a fast paced environment in order to meet strict deadlines
  • High initiative, pro-active and solutions orientated
  • Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Science, Engineering or a related discipline

Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

If you’re ready to step into a culture that will challenge and excite you, submit an application and let’s explore how we go places together.

Applications close 7th September

Graduate

Company Name Latitude Financial Services Company Location 800 Collins St, Docklands, VIC 3008, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 139 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Latitude Graduate Program offers a different graduate experience, providing a holistic understanding of our business.


Our Graduate Program


What if you could BE YOU, BE DIFFERENT, BE OUR FUTURE?


At Latitude, we have a fun and collaborative culture where you will be a valued part of the team from day one. We are constantly trying to innovate and disrupt, coming up with new ways to better our customer experience. You’ll work on Organisation wide projects that are relevant to your interests that have a real, positive impact on customers. As you go, you’ll be guided by a highly supportive network that has a true interest in seeing you develop into a future Latitude Leader.

We have 6 Graduate positions located across our Auckland and Melbourne offices.


Our Graduate Program is different, it runs for 2 years and features:


Rotations in up to 4 key parts of our business to set you up with an enterprise mindset, including;

  • Sales
  • Operations
  • Finance
  • Internal Audit
  • Risk


As well as focused areas of the business to align with your skills and career aspirations:

  • Digital
  • Technology
  • People
  • Commercial


We’re obsessed with providing better outcomes for our customers, so if you bring your passion for customer experience, we’ll provide you with all the foundations you need to succeed, including;

  • Participation in formal and informal learning and development
  • A mentor to provide extensive mentoring and coaching throughout the program
  • A Placement Manager and buddy to provide guidance throughout their rotation.


What do you need to prepare?

To be involved in the Latitude Graduate Program you will need to meet ALL the following criteria:

  • Degree qualified and have graduated from a tertiary institution in the past 24 months.
  • Ability to demonstrate living the Latitude values
  • Citizen or Permanent resident of Australia or New Zealand


How do you apply?

Please submit a video (max. 3 min) covering the below:

  • Tell us about yourself!
  • Why do you want to work at Latitude?
  • How do you live Latitude’s values?


Important: To submit your video, you will need to upload it to YouTube, and provide the link as part of your application.


We’d also love to know about any extracurricular activities you do as we love to give back.

At Latitude, our Affinity program, which brings all employees together and creates events to allow people to network, promotes cultural awareness and contribute to the community, through charity work and fundraising.


To support your application, please also upload:

  • An up to date resume and cover letter, including referees
  • Your academic transcripts


What are some of the perks?

At Latitude, we offer a competitive salary, a diverse range of benefits and retail discounts, Take 5 annual leave program, health and wellbeing activities and so much more.


Please note: Once you have submitted your application you will not be able to go back in and edit it, so please ensure you have met all the criteria.


Applications close Sunday 23rd September 2018. No late applications will be accepted.


Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment. Only open to Australian Permanent Residents and Australian or New Zealand Citizens.
